meanings.definition: The quality or state of being motivated by financial gain or profit.
meanings.sent1: Her mercenarinesses led her to take on extra shifts to earn more money.
meanings.sent2: His mercenarinesses became evident when he chose the job with the highest salary.
meanings.sent3: The cat's mercenarinesses showed when it only played with the toy if given treats.
meanings.sent4: The politician's mercenarinesses shone through as he accepted bribes for favors.
meanings.sent5: The mercenarinesses of the dragon made it hoard gold in its lair.

meanings.definition: The act of hiring oneself out for money or other reward.
meanings.sent1: In times of need, his mercenarinesses led him to offer his services for a fee.
meanings.sent2: The mercenarinesses of the mercenaries made them sought after in times of war.
meanings.sent3: The clown's mercenarinesses were evident when he asked for payment before performing.
meanings.sent4: Her mercenarinesses were like a business transaction, always seeking the best deal.
meanings.sent5: The mercenarinesses of the detective were well-known in the city.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being willing to do anything for money.
meanings.sent1: His mercenarinesses knew no bounds as he took on any job for the right price.
meanings.sent2: The mercenarinesses of the con artist were evident in their willingness to deceive for profit.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's mercenarinesses were comical as it collected shiny objects for treats.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, mercenarinesses can sometimes lead to unethical practices.
meanings.sent5: The mercenarinesses of the beggar were apparent as he begged for money on the street.
